p: However, recent data conclude that even reduced in numbers, Th and Tc cells are overactivated in patients infected with SARS-CoV-2[ 38]. This significant reduction is also observed in the acute-phase response in COVID-19 patients. However, once presented in the organism, CD4+ and CD8 + anti-virus memory T cells persist in the bloodstream of recovered patients for up to 4 years, even in the absence of viral antigens[ 39]. Moreover, other studies detected SARS-CoV-S protein-specific memory T memory cells 4 years after the patients` infection[ 40] and MERS-CoV-specific CD8+ T cells in mice, mainly involved in viral clearance[ 41]. These findings are a reasonable basis for designing effective vaccines against SARS-CoV-2.
